sentence.text: His case came to hinge on one point .
The success of the fraudster often hinges on the ability to tell a convincing story .
After Dowie had given Southampton a 13th-minute lead , the whole course of the match hinged on a startling 10-minute spell in the second half .
The match hinged on the confrontation between Christy O'Connor Jnr and Mark James and it was effectively settled at the first hole .
As often happens , the match can hinge on the form of the kickers , in this case Webb and Botha , their nations ' respective points record-holders .
Success hinged on timing their arrival just as the last fat slice of sun slid below the horizon .
The case hinged , however , on whether the administration of the drug caused the death , and thus to a large extent , the pathological evidence .
Controversy over the use of case studies particularly hinges on how they may be most effectively conducted .
The answer has to be , " get the letters out " , because the success of the operation hinges on this .
The wisdom of such a policy hinges on the likelihood of whether conglomerates will systematically misuse inside information by breaching their Chinese Walls to make a profit or avoid a loss ?
They were then blamed for allowing a Thatcher victory , when Labour 's downfall hinged on a refusal to implement its own policies .
She had ever been curious about Benedict 's background , and now more so than ever , when everything hinged on his moral claim to Merchiston Lodge .
Laming 's defence hinged on his claims that Black was the backer for his plan to undermine racecourse betting and bookmaking in Britain with the stun gun device .
All hinged on accountability .
As university funding has come to hinge on publication , this has been encouraged for its own sake .
The precise nature of this balance hinges upon a series of strategic choices linking novel and established marketing and production priorities within an overall change agenda .
The problem hinges upon fundamental areas such as price -- how much British Gas should pay its UK suppliers -- and also on what is the real nature of the problem .
Much may hinge upon points that the typical executive might understandably regard as irritating technicalities .
The tour took just 15 minutes -- and then came the moment on which Lynsey 's destiny hinged .
It all hinges on motive , on whether Georgina knew about the divorce , and that Arabella was pregnant .
The matter therefore hinges on whether carving directly onto day in the negative is a skill easily acquired .
Everything hinged on how such doctrines were formulated .
The board 's objections hinge on the lyrics : ` Love is love when boys go out with girls , boys with boys and girls with girls . "
Upon these negotiations hinges the future of international trade .
Money hinged on the fact .
Disarmament , for example , is sometimes said to hinge on apparently technical problems such as the comparability of forces , or the possibility of verification .
Suddenly her whole future happiness hinged on Maria Luisa 's choice .
Everything , therefore , hinged on Sartre 's ability to substantiate the inter-dependence of these two claims .
The result hinged on a totally illegal try by Mark Shaw , which contained two , possibly three , infringements .
Disagreement hinged on the new Prime Minister 's insistence that the opposition should join the existing administration .
It was unfortunate then that Virgin 's case should be complicated by , and ultimately hinge upon , another , far less public , contractual dispute .
